page.title: 09SHEEP FARMING
page.content: The land is cultivated up to about 250 metres above sea level. Most of this area is therefore uncultivated rough pasture. The rough pasture is used to graze sheep. Each year the tupps, yearling lambs are sold in Kelso Sheep Market. The ewes are used for breeding or are slaughtered for food. The fleece from the sheep has been spun locally in the past but now few of the local spinning mills are still in operation. Amongst the sheep reared are black face and border leicester. The heather has to be burned off regularly to stunt its growth and encourage new growth suitable for grazing. This also helps to encourage grouse which are shot by groups of people from the big houses on the three estates.
